page.title: 01Highworth: An Introduction.
page.content: Highworth lies 5 miles north of Swindon in Wiltshire on the A361. The older part of the town, centred around the High Street, contains buildings with a wide variety of architectural styles, light industry, and residential areas. Much development has taken place to the north of the town since the 1960s, raising the population of Highworth to over 10,000. Employment opportunities have not risen with equal speed, and the town acts as a dormitory settlement to Swindon and relies heavily on this town for services. To the west of the region, on the B4019, lies the small rural village of Coleshill, set amidst the Wiltshire farmland. This farming land is dominated by arable use, with some areas of pasture land.
